ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned various biochemical lab techniques.
I gained the ability to understand biochemical techniques used in the laboratory.
I learned basic laboratory techniques in biochemistry.

This course was a perfect course for learning many fundamental biochemistry techniques. I learned how to run a gel, how to run PCR reactions, how to plate bacteria on agar and select plaques, and how to use computational modeling softwares. The course was also organized in a great way through which we were focused on a "research goal" throughout.
I learned biochemical techniques such as protein purification, gel extraction, PCR mutagenesis, blue agar assays, kinetics and Pymol.

This class was very important for me to take because it offered me a lot of hands on practice to go side by side with my Biochem lecture. I appreciated the reinforcement of common lab techniques I also used in my independent research.
I learned many useful biochemistry lab techniques like PCR, SDS PAGE, and mutagenesis.
I learned how to perform common biology lab techniques.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course does not have an even workload. There were 2-3 weeks spread throughout the course of the semester that were loaded up with a lot of work. An improvement would be to more evenly space out the work such as making smaller sections of the lab report due.
This course had wonderful teaching lectures and quizzes. Thank you, Professor Pawashe!
This course could have more structured lab instructions, because they became confusing at times.

Strengths: Professor Pawashe was wonderful, very kind and very helpful. She is a great professor, always taking the time to explain new concepts in detail and answer students' questions. She genuinely cares about her students' learning and wants to make sure that students are understanding the material. She really instills a love for biochemistry within her students. She is also a lovely and inspiring human, and I am very glad that I had the opportunity to take this class with her. The class was also organized in a really interesting and engaging way. Throughout the semester, we had a "research project" which stayed consistent throughout and we performed various experiments (we ran PCR reactions and gels and isolated mutant DNA etc etc) all with the same research goal. This consistent big-picture goal really made the work interesting and meaningful. The TA, Jummie, was also very helpful and very kind, and always available to answer questions. Weaknesses: None!

Strengths: Prof Aruna is very lovely and TAs were great. 

Weaknesses: The lab days could be shortened to exclude non-lab activities.
I think the class was very strong because of the level of engagement of the students.
Course procedure was very clear. I wished that introduction lectures were slightly shorter.
The course is taught as a single research project with each week being a new step in the research. This helped to fit everything together so you can feel how it is to actually perform this research.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to a student who has not worked in a biochemistry research lab previously.

I would recommend this course to another student if they are interested in understanding the basic techniques of biochemistry. This course is less helpful to learn biochemistry and moreso to understand laboratory techniques.
Id recommend this course to anyone lacking wet lab skills that can be applied to their own research labs.

Yes!! This course is a perfect course if you want to learn really important, fundamental biochemistry techniques. You will get to learn really key experimental techniques, which you often read about in textbooks and which will probably be super useful for anyone looking to do biology-based research.
I would recommend this lab course to anyone that is looking to learn biochemical techniques.
I would recommend this course to any students taking Biochem lecture.
I would recommend! The course helped me understand a lot of experiments that Ive heard about in classes.
I would recommend this to any premeds or someone who has no other biology lab experience.
